taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Andropogon glomeratus var. scabriglumis C.S. Campb.

bio:treatment.description: Plants oblanceolate to obpyramidal in the upper portion. Culms 80-150 cm; internodes not glaucous. Sheaths usually scabrous; ligules ciliate, cilia 0.2-0.5 mm; blades green, smooth or pubescent. Subtending sheaths of inflorescence units (2.3)2.9-4.5(6.3) cm long, (1.5)2.3-3.3(4.4) mm wide; peduncles (2)5-10(16) mm; rames (1.7)1.9-2.3(2.8) cm, exerted. Keels of lower glumes usually scabrous below and above the midpoint.
bio:treatment.discussion: Andropogon glomeratus var. scabriglumis grows in moist soils of seepage slopes and the edges of springs, from California to New Mexico and southward into Mexico.
